author: protolambda
content:
The merge-sharding hackathon project has a name now: Rayonism ‚òÄÔ∏è   https://rayonism.io/

The idea is to build a Merge testnet, and then extend with Sharding during the EthGlobal Scaling hackathon (mid April - mid May). This is all super experimental, but a great way for everyone to get involved with the merge work, and push those scaling limits.

In the next two weeks we'll continue to develop the "meta-specs": a place for everything around current merge/sharding specs, implementation work, and hackathon specifics. Around the hackathon start we aim to stabilize this, and move it into a GitHub repo for more open iteration on it.
You can find more planning on the site and in the meta-specs. We'll try to organize some early-bird call next week or so for those who don't like to wait. Get involved!

author: tyneslol
content: hello! üëã  i'm interested in attending the call

author: protolambda
content: There is a call *Thursday about the Merge in general, see <#692062809701482577>  channel. Not required, but if you like to contribute, maybe worth attending. On that call we will figure out a good date/time for next week, where we focus on some of the early challenges before the hackathon.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: This is not going to be submitted to the hackathon right? I'm mentoring, but would like to get involved anyway

author: protolambda
content: See F.A.Q. on the site, it's not going to be an actual submission. We don't compete for a prize or submit to the judges, we just tag along for the hackathon vibe.

author: protolambda
content: Any regular hackathon participant building some smaller hack, like a dapp on a merge testnet, or some new L2 thing with shard data, fully qualifies though.
